DOCNAME: CASE OF SVETLANA NAUMENKO v. UKRAINE
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1 with regard to the length of the proceedings;Violation of Art. 6-1 with regard to the right to a court;Violation of Art. 6-1 with regard to impartiality;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses partial award
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant , PERSON , was born on DATE and currently resides in GPE .

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the applicant was recognised as having been a relief worker at the CARDINAL Chernobyl Nuclear Plant disaster . The appropriate certificate ( an identity card ) was issued to the applicant by ORG of the NORP GPE .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicant was recognised as falling within the second category of invalidity in relation to her participation in the relief work at GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of the NORP GPE annulled the certificate issued on CARDINAL DATE because the applicant had not stayed and worked in the “ GPE alienation zone ” ( тридцятикілометрова зона або зона відчудження)*.

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed a petition filed by the chief doctor of ORG ( the applicant 's place of employment ) requesting that the employees ( including the applicant ) of ORG who had worked in the alienation zone be given the status of relief workers .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG informed the chief doctor of ORG that there were no documents proving that the employees had stayed in the alienation zone .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicant lodged complaints with ORG of Odessa , seeking to establish that she had indeed stayed in the alienation zone . On DATE the ORG of GPE delivered a judgment in which it accepted that the applicant had stayed in the alienation zone on CARDINAL and CARDINAL DATE . The judgment became enforceable on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed as groundless the motion filed by the Chairman of ORG on ORG to reverse the judgment of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG issued a certificate ( an identity card ) acknowledging the applicant 's status as a victim of the GPE disaster , as established by the decision of DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG no . FAC introducing amendments to its earlier Resolution of DATE no . CARDINAL on the Procedure for LAW ) to Victims of the Chernobyl Catastrophe . By virtue of these amendments , court judgments could not serve as a basis for the issue of certificates ( identity cards ) nor provide proof of being a victim of the disaster and thereby give entitlement to special ORG benefits and social payments .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG refused to confirm the applicant 's status as a GPE victim since the relief work had taken place outside the alienation zone .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG on ORG ( the “ Commission ” ) annulled the decision of CARDINAL DATE by which a certificate was issued to the applicant .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Chairman of ORG of ORG adopted a decision withdrawing the certificate from the applicant , suspending her social security payments and annulling the benefits awarded to her as a victim of the GPE disaster .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Commission adopted a decision annulling the certificate .
CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant lodged a complaint with ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG informed the applicant by letter that the refusal to issue a certificate could be appealed in accordance with the procedure established by law .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant instituted proceedings in ORG of Odessa in order to annul the decision of DATE and to oblige the Commission to recognise her status as a GPE victim and to re - issue the certificate .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG allowed her claims and declared the actions of the Commission unlawful . It also annulled the ORG 's decisions and ordered it to issue a document recognising the applicant 's status as a GPE victim . The decision became enforceable on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG annulled its decision of DATE and confirmed the applicant 's status as a relief worker . The applicant 's name was entered in the register of disabled GPE relief workers .

CARDINAL . In DATE the Deputy Chairman of ORG on ORG filed a motion with the President of ORG , requesting the President to lodge a protest against the decision of CARDINAL DATE with a view to quashing it .
CARDINAL . On DATE the President of ORG dismissed this petition as unsubstantiated .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Commission issued a GPE victim identity card to the applicant . The applicant 's name was also entered in the list of persons who had requested improved living conditions .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed a motion with ORG of Odessa for an interpretation of its judgment of CARDINAL DATE . She also requested that the ORG calculate her benefits and pension as from DATE and compensate her for arrears in benefits from that same date .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of Odessa allowed the applicant 's claims and ruled that the amount of compensation , arrears and benefits was to be calculated and paid to the applicant as from DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant requested ORG of Odessa to issue her a writ of execution in respect of the ruling of DATE . On CARDINAL DATE ORG of Odessa allowed the applicant 's request and issued this writ .
CARDINAL . The execution proceedings commenced on DATE , i.e. DATE after ORG had received the writ .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held that it had no jurisdiction over the enforcement of the ruling in the applicant 's case .

CARDINAL . On DATE ( CARDINAL DATE according to ORG ) the Deputy President of ORG lodged a protest with the Presidium of ORG , requesting that the case be re - examined and the judgment of ORG of Odessa of DATE establishing the fact of the applicant 's stay in the alienation zone reversed .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of ORG allowed the protest and quashed the decision of DATE . It also remitted the case to ORG of Odessa for re - consideration .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of Odessa upheld the applicant 's complaint , finding that she had stayed in the alienation zone on CARDINAL and CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Odessa ORG lodged an appeal against the judgment of DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the case file was transferred to the ORG of Appeal . However , it was sent back to ORG of Odessa on DATE since it was necessary to rule on the request for leave to appeal against the decision of DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of GPE found that ORG had failed to comply with the formalities envisaged by law for the introduction of appeals . The ORG was given until DATE to rectify this shortcoming .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rectified the shortcoming and appealed against the decision of DATE , seeking its annulment .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG extended until DATE the time - limit for ORG to lodge a petition .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of Appeal sent the case file to ORG of Odessa requesting it to rule on the formal defects in the appeal that had been introduced out of time .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of Odessa allowed the ORG 's motion to extend the time - limit for filing an appeal with ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of Odessa sent the case file to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the NORP ORG of Appeal decided to initiate appeal proceedings in the case and scheduled a hearing on the merits for DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG quashed the decision of DATE and remitted the case to the same first - instance court .
DATE . On DATE the case file was remitted to ORG of Odessa for further consideration .
CARDINAL . DATE and DATE the case could not be heard as the judge was on leave .
CARDINAL . The case was scheduled for examination on DATE .

CARDINAL . The hearing was adjourned to CARDINAL DATE as ORG , the ORG enterprise ORG and ORG had failed to comply with the court 's order of DATE to provide relevant documentary evidence of the applicant 's involvement in relief work at GPE . The evidence requested by the court did not arrive until DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Illichevsk District Court of Odessa held a hearing in the applicant 's case . On DATE the court postponed the hearing until DATE in order to summon specific witnesses .
CARDINAL . On DATE the hearing was rescheduled for DATE as the ORG had requested that additional witnesses be summoned .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court heard the additional witnesses . It also scheduled another hearing for DATE in order to allow time for the transfer of the case file relating to the applicant 's status as a GPE relief worker from FAC of Odessa .
CARDINAL . On DATE the hearing was rescheduled as the ORG 's representative did not have a valid letter of authority . The next hearing was scheduled for DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a motion with the court seeking the adjournment of the hearing in her case so that she could provide additional information about her claims . The hearing was rescheduled for DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of Odessa ( the case having been transferred to this court in accordance with the territorial division of the districts of GPE ) found that the applicant had been a relief worker at FAC in DATE and had stayed in the “ alienation zone ” . There was no appeal against this decision and it became final on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE GPE initiated execution proceedings in the case .
CARDINAL . NORP The decision of DATE was executed on CARDINAL DATE once the applicant had received the GPE victim certificate .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Malinovsky ORG terminated the execution proceedings since they had been completed .
CARDINAL . On DATE FAC of Odessa gave an interpretation of the judgment of DATE to the effect that the applicant stayed in the alienation zone from CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . DATE ORG of Odessa awarded the applicant ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL.CARDINAL in unpaid pension for the period from DATE to CARDINAL DATE . It also held that the applicant 's DATE salary should be ORG CARDINAL .
CARDINAL . Relevant provisions of the LAW read as follows :
“ ... The main principles of judicial proceedings are :
CARDINAL ) NORP legality ;
... CARDINAL ) the mandatory nature of court decisions . ”
CARDINAL . Relevant provisions of LAW read as follows :
“ Court decisions , rulings and resolutions may be reviewed in supervisory review proceedings following a protest lodged by the officials designated in LAW . ”
“ The following persons have the right to lodge a protest against an enforceable court judgment , ruling or resolution :

... CARDINAL ) NORP presidents of ORG , regional courts , GPE and LOC city courts and their deputies - against decisions and rulings of the district ( city ) , inter - district ( county ) court , and also against the cassation rulings of the civil division of ORG , regional courts , and the GPE and LOC city courts ; ... ”
“ The following courts hear cases in supervisory review proceedings : ...

CARDINAL . The Presidium of ORG of the GPE , regional courts , GPE and LOC city courts : as regards protests lodged by the President of ORG , ORG and their deputies , Presidents of ORG , regional , GPE and LOC city courts and their deputies - against the judgments and rulings of the district ( city ) , inter - district ( county ) courts and against judgments of the district ( city ) courts , inter - district ( county ) courts and against the cassation rulings of ORG , regional courts , GPE and LOC city courts ; ... ”
“ Officials who have the right to lodge a protest may suspend execution of the relevant judgments , rulings and resolutions until DATE of the supervisory review proceedings .

The lodging of a protest against a judgment adopted following a complaint about unlawful actions by an official who interferes with the citizen 's lawful rights suspends execution of that decision until the end of the supervisory review proceedings . ”
“ Parties and other persons participating in the case have the right to lodge written explanations regarding the protest .
Persons informed about the place and time of consideration of the case can at their request participate in the proceedings . Their absence does not influence the consideration of the case . ”
“ When considering a case in supervisory review proceedings , the court has the right by its ruling or resolution to :
CARDINAL ) NORP leave a judgment , ruling , resolution without changes , and refuse a protest ;
CARDINAL ) NORP annul a judgment , ruling or resolution in whole or in part and remit the case for re - consideration to the court of first or cassation instance ;
CARDINAL ) NORP annul a judgment , ruling or resolution fully or partially and terminate proceedings in a case or leave it without consideration ;
CARDINAL ) NORP leave one of the previously adopted judgments in the case , or one of the rulings or resolutions without satisfaction ;
CARDINAL )

“ The directions of the court that made the supervisory review are binding on the court which later re - examines the case . These directions are binding within the limits established by LAW of this Code .

When considering a case in supervisory review proceedings or annulling the cassation decision , the court has no authority to determine the conclusions that could be made in the course of re - consideration of the case by the cassation court . ”
CARDINAL . Relevant provisions of the Law of DATE read as follows :
“ CARDINAL . This PERSON shall enter into force on DATE ...
CARDINAL . Appeals in civil cases lodged before DATE shall be considered in accordance with the procedure adopted for the examination of appeals against local court judgments .
CARDINAL . Protests against judgments lodged before DATE shall be sent to ORG of GPE for consideration in accordance with the cassation procedure .
CARDINAL . Judgments that have been delivered and which have become enforceable before DATE can be appealed against within DATE in accordance with the cassation procedure ( to ORG ) . ”
CARDINAL . Relevant provisions of LAW DATE read as follows :

“ Relief workers dealing with the consequences of the GPE nuclear power plant disaster are those citizens who took part directly in any work related to dealing with the disaster itself or its consequences in the alienation zone in DATE regardless of DATE worked , and in DATE for not CARDINAL DATE , including the evacuation of persons and property from this zone , and those temporarily present there or assigned there from their place of employment within the designated terms for the execution of works in the alienation zone , including military servicemen , civil servants ( якщо це державні службовці ) , the public , enterprises , institutions and organisations regardless of their jurisdiction and those who worked not less than DATE in DATE in the acting ambulance stations for the decontamination of the population and the deactivation of the equipment or buildings . The list of these stations is drawn up by ORG . ”
“ Persons who are considered victims of the GPE nuclear power plant disaster are the following : ...

CARDINAL ) persons who worked for DATE from the time of the accident until DATE or for DATE during DATE outside the exclusion zone in particularly harmful working conditions ( taking into account radioactivity factors ) , where this work was related to the elimination of the consequences of the GPE nuclear plant disaster and was carried out on the basis of instructions received from the Government . The types of work and territories to be covered are determined by ORG . ”
DATE . Relevant provisions of the ORG no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE read as follows :
“ ... persons assisting in eliminating the consequences of the nuclear power plant disaster shall be issued certificates on the basis of CARDINAL of the following documents :
a ) a certificate of assignment to the alienation zone ;
b ) a military certificate ;
c ) a certificate of proof of bonus payments for participation in the relief work ;

d ) ( excluded on the basis of ORG no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL.CARDINAL.CARDINAL ) a decision of a court establishing direct participation in any work for a certain period related to dealing with the consequences of the nuclear power plant disaster , its consequences in the alienation zone , including the evacuation of persons and property from this zone ...
The decision to issue or not to issue the relevant certificate shall be adopted within DATE from the date of receipt of the necessary documents by the body issuing such a certificate . ”
CARDINAL . Relevant provisions of the ORG no . CARDINAL of DATE read as follows :
“ ... Commentary : The town of PERSON to which the applicant was assigned from the place of his employment ( GPE ) is not included in the list of localities ... ”
CARDINAL . Relevant provisions of the ORG no . CARDINAL of DATE read as follows :
“ CARDINAL . ( delete paragraph CARDINAL from ORG . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE ) .

CARDINAL . Commissions on disputed issues regarding the determination of the status of persons who assisted in dealing with the consequences of the nuclear power plant disaster , created at ORG ... shall verify the issue of certificates to victims of the GPE nuclear plant disaster on the basis of judicial decisions and shall take action where they find a violation of the procedure for establishing such status . ”
CARDINAL . Relevant provisions of ORG of DATE read as follows :

“ CARDINAL . ... – in accordance with the PERSON of GPE on ORG and ORG on the Procedure for LAW , adopted in accordance with the PERSON , certificates may be issued on the basis of a court judgment establishing the person 's specific participation in any kind of work for a certain period of time ( determined by the legislation ) related to eliminating the consequences of the disaster and its consequences in the alienation zone , including the evacuation of persons and property from such zones , and/or the works in the acting ambulance stations for decontamination of the population and deactivation of equipment . All other issues concerning the status of the victims of the GPE nuclear power plant disaster shall be determined on the basis of the relevant documentation of the commissions of the executive bodies of the GPE and ORG , and disputes shall be settled by the commissions of ORG of GPE and GPE and of ORG . ”
